item.title: 特朗普重申对华关税威胁后大豆下跌
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示考虑对中国征收关税后，大豆在芝加哥下跌，激起了人们对这两个最大经济体之间爆发贸易战的新忧虑。小麦和玉米也出现下跌。【原文：Soybeans fell in Chicago after US President Donald Trump said he’s considering tariffs on China, stoking fresh worries of a trade war between the two biggest economies. Wheat and corn also declined.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德即将斥资 9.5 亿美元收购 Divvy Homes
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的人士透露，布鲁克菲尔德资产管理有限公司（Brookfield Asset Management Ltd.）即将达成一项交易，通过收购初创公司 Divvy Homes，以约 9.5 亿美元的价格购买 3800 套单户出租房。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. is nearing a deal to buy 3,800 single-family rentals for about $950 million through an acquisition of startup Divvy Homes, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日本央行向加息迈进，市场坦然面对特朗普
item.description: 在全球金融市场对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫做出相对平静的反应之后，日本央行行长上田一夫有望在周五将利率上调至2008年以来的最高水平。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda is on track to raise interest rates to the highest level since 2008 on Friday, after global financial markets responded with relative calm to US President Donald Trump’s return to the White House.】

item.description: 随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普继续阐述其对贸易和移民政策的看法，交易员们密切关注着全球经济的前景。【原文：Gold held near the highest since early November, with traders monitoring the outlook for the global economy as President Donald Trump continued to sketch out his views on trade and immigration policies.】

item.title: 软银股价飙升，与 OpenAI、甲骨文合作推进千亿美元人工智能计划
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布日本公司、OpenAI 和甲骨文公司将斥资数十亿美元在美国建设人工智能基础设施后，软银集团公司的股价最高上涨了 8.1%。【原文：Shares of SoftBank Group Corp. jumped as much as 8.1% after US President Donald Trump announced a multi-billion dollar push by the Japanese company, OpenAI and Oracle Corp. to build AI infrastructure in the US.】

item.title: 游说团体称爱尔兰经济在多年快速增长后将降温
item.description: 爱尔兰主要的商业游说团体称，受贸易不确定性和关键基础设施瓶颈等因素的影响，爱尔兰的经济增长将趋缓。【原文：Ireland’s economic growth is set to moderate due to factors including uncertainty over trade and bottlenecks around critical infrastructure, according to the nation’s main business lobby.】

item.title: 创纪录的牛肉进口量增加了中国实施贸易限制的风险
item.description: 中国创纪录的牛肉进口正在冲击需求放缓、价格跌至2019年以来最低点的市场，这增加了政府采取措施遏制牛肉贸易的风险。【原文：China’s record beef imports are hitting a market where demand is slowing and prices have fallen to the lowest since 2019, raising the risk that authorities will take steps to curb the trade.】

item.title: 特朗普发表对华关税言论后美元推高
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普重申他正在权衡对中国征收 10%关税之后，美元兑主要货币汇率周三走强。【原文：The dollar strengthened against major peers Wednesday after President Donald Trump reiterated he was weighing a 10% tariff on China.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税威胁引发贸易战担忧，石油止跌回升
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对中国征收关税，并表示正在考虑对加拿大和墨西哥征收巨额关税，这引发了人们对多方面贸易战的担忧。【原文：Oil held losses as President Donald Trump threatened a tariff on China, raising concerns over trade wars on several fronts after he said hefty levies on Canada and Mexico were being considered.】

item.title: 市场综述：特朗普关税担忧消退，亚洲股市将上涨
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在全球贸易问题上的基调好于预期，而且人们越来越多地猜测他的政策将进一步提振美国企业界，因此美国股市攀升，亚洲期货普遍指向上涨。【原文：Asian futures broadly pointed to gains after US stocks climbed as President Donald Trump struck a better-than-feared tone on global trade and speculation grew that his policies will further boost Corporate America.】

item.description: 日本股市现在才意识到创纪录的高消费游客可能带来的收益。【原文：Japan’s stock market is only now waking up to potential gains from record numbers of big-spending tourists.】

item.title: 新西兰通胀率意外放缓，仍为 2.2
item.description: 去年最后三个月，新西兰的年度通胀率出乎意料地没有放缓，仍然高于中央银行目标区间的中点。【原文：New Zealand’s annual inflation unexpectedly failed to slow in the final three months of last year, remaining above the midpoint of the central bank’s target band.】

item.title: 加拿大致特朗普我们对边境也有抱怨
item.description: 加拿大总理表示，加强边境安全 "既符合加拿大人的利益，也符合美国人的利益"，并对从美国北上的非法枪支和毒品数量不断增加表示担忧。【原文：Canada’s prime minister said it’s “in the interest of Canadians as well as Americans” to strengthen border security and raised concern about the rising volume of illegal guns and drugs flowing north from the US.】

item.title: 关税威胁引发加拿大石油涌向美国
item.description: 大量加拿大石油正南下美国，以抵御唐纳德-特朗普总统威胁征收的关税。【原文：A flood of Canadian oil is heading south to the US to beat President Donald Trump’s threatened tariffs.】

item.title: 人工智能语音编码初创公司 StackBlitz 正洽谈 7 亿美元估值事宜
item.description: StackBlitz公司是开发工具Bolt.new的制造商，该公司首席执行官表示，公司正在与投资者进行谈判，以7亿美元的估值进行融资。【原文：StackBlitz Inc., the maker of developer tool Bolt.new, is finalizing talks to raise money from investors at a $700 million valuation, its chief executive officer said — the latest deal for an artificial intelligence startup promising to change computer programming and coding.】

item.title: 彼得罗将任命 30 年老盟友担任哥伦比亚外交事务主管
item.description: 古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）总统将任命其高级助手、30 岁的劳拉-萨拉维娅（Laura Sarabia）担任哥伦比亚下一任外交部长，她是担任这一职务的最年轻官员之一。【原文：President Gustavo Petro will appoint top aide, 30-year-old Laura Sarabia, as Colombia’s next foreign affairs minister, one the youngest-ever officials to assume the role.】

item.title: 马斯克称美国联邦贸易委员会对微软的关注加强了他的 OpenAI 主张
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克在一份法庭文件中说，美国联邦贸易委员会对微软公司向 OpenAI 投资 130 亿美元的关注 "证实 "了这位亿万富翁的说法，即这家初创公司与科技巨头之间的协议是反竞争的。【原文：Elon Musk said in a court filing that the US Federal Trade Commission’s concern over Microsoft Corp.’s $13 billion investment in OpenAI “confirms” the billionaire’s claims that the pact between the startup and technology giant is anticompetitive.】

item.title: 华尔街顶级银行因首次公开募股量复苏而获得 ECM 收入

item.title: 特朗普下令加速全美项目许可计划

item.description:

item.title: 被 TikTok 迷住的美容业为不确定的未来做好准备
item.description: 周六晚上，数亿美国人领略了没有 TikTok 的生活会是什么样子，至少有一个品牌决定继续进行试验。【原文：Saturday night gave hundreds of millions of Americans a taste of what life without TikTok would look like, and at least one brand decided to keep the experiment going.】

item.title: Meta 计划推出奥克利品牌眼镜，开发手表和耳塞
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司正在对其广受欢迎的智能眼镜进行升级，并在探索新的可穿戴设备，如手表和配备摄像头的耳塞，旨在将其人工智能功能嵌入到更多产品中。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. is working on upgrades to its popular smart glasses and is exploring new wearable devices such as watches and camera-equipped earbuds, aiming to embed its artificial intelligence features into more products.】

item.title: 英国罢免反垄断监察机构主席，释放增长信号
item.description: 英国政府已经解除了英国竞争监管机构--竞争与市场管理局主席的职务，大臣们试图强化这样一个信息，即他们希望监管机构为促进经济增长做更多工作。【原文：The UK government has ousted the chair of the Competition and Markets Authority, Britain’s competition watchdog, as ministers seek to reinforce the message that they want regulators to do more to facilitate economic growth.】

item.title: 道明银行面临资产上限，欲出售 90 亿美元抵押贷款
item.description: 多伦多道明银行（Toronto-Dominion Bank）正在寻求出售约 90 亿美元的住宅抵押贷款，因为这家加拿大贷款机构正在调整其资产负债表，以符合美国监管机构规定的新上限，这也是去年就其未能防止洗钱达成的认罪协议的一部分。【原文：Toronto-Dominion Bank is looking to sell about $9 billion of residential mortgage loans as the Canadian lender adjusts its balance sheet to comply with a new cap imposed by US regulators, part of a plea agreement reached last year for its role in failing to prevent money laundering.】
